intro: Vellozia panamensis, commonly known as the Panama vellozia, is a rare and unique plant species native to Panama. It belongs to the family Velloziaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are adapted to arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is found in tropical dry forests. Its flowers are small and clustered, often in a spike-like arrangement, and are typically yellow or greenish in color. Vellozia panamensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, contributing to local biodiversity.
